alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, central Pocahontas and east central Webster Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Addison (Webster Springs), or near Webster Springs, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cass Scenic Railroad, Snowshoe, Mingo, Monterville, Slaty Fork, Valley Head, Bergoo and Waneta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
